intro: Draba haradjianii, commonly known as the Haradjian's rockcress, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its foliage consists of basal leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Draba haradjianii is considered a rare and endangered species.
